definition: to talk drivel/to make irresponsible remarks
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary

sentences.english: Have not used the Freeze said, okay.

sentences.english: I understand that I can't go out to blather.

sentences.english: I'm not being abusive here , but trying to look at the lighter side of life.

sentences.english: Dare not to blather numerous loquacious ill of rice department, smile 1 first into a positive.

sentences.english: Loose lips really can cause trouble .

sentences.english: People just spoke indiscreetly and we were completely flummoxed.

sentences.english: Don't talk recklessly before a matter ins't completely clear.

sentences.english: Do you want to do, something else, let go to pig.

sentences.english: I'm sure some of them say I had a big mouth and said things I shouldn't have said.

definition: to talk nonsense/nonsense!
to talk drivel/to assert sth without a proper understanding or basis in fact/not to know what one is talking about
to talk nonsense/drivel
to talk rubbish
to act recklessly/to mess around
to chatter/nonsense/blather
talkative/to speak out of turn/to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/rumors fly

to speak without thinking/to blurt sth out

to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
babbling nonsense (idiom); crazy and unfounded ravings/double Dutch
